title: How to Remove Fly Specks from Books

steps.headline: Find a sturdy eraser.
steps.description: Ensure that it is clean and doesn't have any pencil or marker marks on it, as these may transfer to the book pages. You can remove marks on the eraser by rubbing it up and down a wooden board, desk or other neutral flat object to remove the marked layers of the eraser. Once clean, it is ready to use.

steps.headline: Rub at the fly specks one by one.
steps.description: In most cases, the eraser will easily lift the specks off but you may need to keep at it for a bit. Do not rub so hard that you tear the pages; take a break if it is getting frustrating.

steps.headline: Try white bread.
steps.description: The bread used should be fresh so that it is very soft still.

steps.headline: Tear off a small piece of the white bread.
steps.description: Work it into a small ball with your fingers.

steps.headline: Roll the ball of bread over the fly speck areas of the pages or book edge until the specks wear off.
Repeat as needed with fresh balls of white bread.
steps.description: It may take quite a few tries before you've removed all of the specks.

text: Using a Standard Eraser Find a sturdy eraser. Ensure that it is clean and doesn't have any pencil or marker marks on it, as these may transfer to the book pages. You can remove marks on the eraser by rubbing it up and down a wooden board, desk or other neutral flat object to remove the marked layers of the eraser. Once clean, it is ready to use. Rub at the fly specks one by one. In most cases, the eraser will easily lift the specks off but you may need to keep at it for a bit. Do not rub so hard that you tear the pages; take a break if it is getting frustrating. Using White Bread Try white bread. The bread used should be fresh so that it is very soft still. Tear off a small piece of the white bread. Work it into a small ball with your fingers. Roll the ball of bread over the fly speck areas of the pages or book edge until the specks wear off.  Repeat as needed with fresh balls of white bread. It may take quite a few tries before you've removed all of the specks.
